title: Street art thanks NHS staff for tackling coronavirus
content: Spectacular street art has sprung up all over England to thank NHS workers for their dedication during the coronavirus pandemic.Artists up and down the country have used their talents to make a big show of their gratitude, with some creations spanning huge walls.Sculptor Jamie Wardley <https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/uk-england-leeds-52307138/coronavirus-100m-long-nhs-tribute-in-mytholmroyd-field> created a 100-metre long tribute in a Yorkshire field, while welderPete Henson <https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-somerset-52373943> made a 1.8m (6ft) statue of a nurse in Exmoor.Mural artist Rachel List <https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/uk-england-leeds-52331706/artist-brightens-up-town-with-nhs-tribute-murals> has been prolific in Pontefract. She said: "I think people just want to show their appreciation for the NHS and hopefully, I have, in some small way allowed that message to travel."Here's a look at some of the stunning tributes to the NHS staff.By Jennifer Meierhans
